instances.text: PSYC_V 325-003 - Socialization: Media Content and Effects
PSYC_V 333-003 - Memory: Historical, Clinical and Cognitive Perspectives
PSYC_V 333-004 - Memory: Historical, Clinical and Cognitive Perspectives
PSYC_V 336-901 - The Psychology of Language I
PSYC_V 350-902 - Psychological Aspects of Human Sexuality
PSYC_V 371-002 - Behavioural and Cognitive Neuroscience II
PSYC_V 388-C_003 - Directed Studies in Behavioural Neuroscience (C)
RGST_V 300-201 - Theory and Method in the Study of Religion

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Course Description: 
"Religion is solely the creation of the scholars study, the famous theorist of religion Jonathan Z. Smith once pronounced. Religion has no existence apart from the academy. Smiths point was that our understanding of what religion is and how it works in any given context depends on the theory of religion, implicit or explicit, that shapes our research questions and methods of analysis. So, what theory of religion should you use in your research? In this course, we critically examine some of the most influential classical theories of religion, theories of religion that have been marginalized because their authors werent white men, and a range of current approaches to religion. This course will help you to understand how theory and method work in Religious Studies and will empower you to develop and refine your own methods for studying religion.

instances.text: RMST_V 302-201 - Theatre and Poetry of the Romance World

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Theatre and poetry of the Romance-speaking world from the Middle Ages to the present day from a comparative perspective.
See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst302/

Language of Instruction: English

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: RMST_V 310-B_201 - Special Topics in Romance Studies (B)
RMST_V 321-201 - French Literature from the Middle Ages to the Revolution

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
A World of Marvels. Marvellousness suffuses French and global premodern literatures. From monsters to miracles, from mysterious other-worldly beings to marginal drolleries, from imaginative marvels and their preservation through storytelling, explore texts that help us to understand perceptions of pre-modernity and their continuity into our present world.
MDVL 301 and RMST 321 are taught in the same classroom at the same time by the same instructor.  Please register as RMST 321 if you are enrolled in an RMST major or minor program. 

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst321/

Language of Instruction: English

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: RMST_V 350-B_201 - Special Topics in Italian Studies (B)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Italian Food Culture. Examine cultural representations of Italian or Italian-derived foods and the role that they play in articulating larger social issues in contemporary Italy, including regionalism, anti-globalization, family history, gender and sexual identities, Italian American food, tourism in Italy, and immigration to Italy.
ITAL380 andRMST350 aretemporarilyco-locatedfor2024W.PleaseregisterforRMST350.

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst350

Language of Instruction: English

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: RMST_V 361-201 - Studies in Portuguese and Brazilian Literature

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course offers a panoramic view of modern and contemporary Brazilian cinema and literature in relation to history, social dynamics, diversity, politics, and language.
PORT 392 and RMST 361 are taught in the same classroom at the same time by the same instructor. All students must register in RMST 361. Both courses fulfill the literature requirement for the Faculty of Arts.

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst361/

Language of Instruction: English

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: RMST_V 375-201 - The Caribbean: Frontiers of the Romance World

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Literature and culture from the island of Hispaniola (Haiti, Dominican Republic) and the French Caribbean from a comparative perspective.
See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst375/

Language of Instruction: English

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
